name: tape_interface
brief:
Tape management interface for ADOL-C automatic differentiation

Provides functions for managing the "tape" - a recorded sequence of
operations that can be replayed in forward or reverse mode to compute
derivatives.

algorithms.name:
Tape-Based Operation Recording:
ADOL-C implements automatic differentiation by recording a "tape" of
elementary operations during function evaluation:

RECORDING PHASE (trace_on to trace_off):
1. Each adouble gets a unique location on the tape
2. Operations (+, -, *, /, sin, exp, etc.) record:
   - Operation code (opcode)
   - Input locations
   - Output location
   - Primal value (for reverse mode)
3. Result: Directed acyclic graph (DAG) of operations

TAPE STRUCTURE:
- Operations buffer: sequence of opcodes
- Locations buffer: tape indices for operands/results
- Values buffer: constant values embedded in computation
- Taylor buffer: intermediate values for forward/reverse

THREAD SAFETY:
Each thread has its own tape buffer (thread_local storage).
Tapes are identified by short integer IDs (0-32767).
algorithms.math:
Tape interpretation:
A tape represents a function F: ℝⁿ → ℝᵐ as composition of elementary ops:
  v_{-n+1}, ..., v_0           = x (inputs)
  v_i = φ_i(v_{j(i)}, v_{k(i)})  for i = 1, ..., p (intermediates)
  y = (v_{p-m+1}, ..., v_p)    = F(x) (outputs)

Forward mode propagates tangents: v̇_i = (∂φ_i/∂v_j)·v̇_j + (∂φ_i/∂v_k)·v̇_k
Reverse mode propagates adjoints: v̄_j += (∂φ_i/∂v_j)·v̄_i (in reverse order)
algorithms.complexity:
Recording: O(ops) time and space
Forward evaluation: O(ops) per direction
Reverse evaluation: O(ops) per adjoint
